q: . We've had weird moments.'' Steven Tyler , however, told ''Late Show'' host David Letterman that he prefers the way he became famous to the ''Idol'' road to stardom. I always thought that in order to become an American Idol, or any kind of idol, you have to pay your dues, Steven Tyler said, referring to the years of national touring he did with Aerosmith. ''But, today's a different world.'' But, ''This way is more fun,'' he adds of

Simon Cowell is also excited to have kids as young as 12 years old audition- an opinion he didn't always have. American Idol? ''I haven't seen a full episode,'' he said. I saw a three-minute recap. From what I've seen and from what I've heard, it all seems to be going well. And I always thought that would be the case. ''What I was more concerned about was the ratings falling off a cliff, meaning that the whole genre might be over, Simon Cowell continued. ''The good news is that people are still excited about these shows, whether it be... Dancing With the Stars, which has gotten better over the years, America's Got Talent.

Gordon Brown 's office declined to comment, but Labour deputy leader Harriet Harman said police must investigate the allegations. Hacking into people's phones is illegal. Obviously the criminal law has got to be complied with and if it is broken then it should be investigated by the police and it should be enforced, she told Sky News. Donald Rumsfeld takes particular offense at Colin Powell 's contention that he was misled by faulty intelligence into making the public case for the invasion of Iraq. '' Colin Powell was not duped or misled by anybody,'' Donald Rumsfeld writes. Nor did he lie about Saddam Hussein 's suspected WMD stockpiles. The president did not lie. The vice president did not lie.[ CIA Director President Bush ] Tenet did not lie. Condoleezza Rice did not lie. I did not lie.... The far less dramatic truth is that we were wrong. Even so, Donald Rumsfeld - who does reveal that President Bush asked for Iraq invasion plans within days of 9/11- argues that removing Saddam Hussein was the right thing to do.
